The SJSD has made two important updates to our reentry plan:

📅 To make sure we are in the best situation possible for reentry we feel some additional days are needed to help with multiple items before school begins. To accomplish this, we will move the start date for students to August 31st. The academic calendar and all enrollment dates remain the same.

😷 After listening to our parent, guardian, and student feedback and with recommendations from the CDC, St. Joseph Health Department, and Mosaic Life Care, the school district is adjusting the language used regarding its mask/face covering policy. Masks or face coverings will not only be expected they will now be REQUIRED when social distancing cannot occur.

For more information, visit: https://bit.ly/30YNSVx

"You are the best."

If you ever wondered about the impact our schools have on the community -- the efforts underway this week offer a small glimpse at the many services provided throughout the district. This week we've seen students stepping outside with signs just to let teachers know they miss them, staff members loading up sack lunches to make sure kids are fed, school resource officers jumping in to help because they care about the wellbeing of students and many others working remotely to provide distance learning. Thank you to our amazing teachers and staff, and to you - our families - for helping from home. We know this hasn't been easy, but we will get through it together.

We would love to see your photos too! Teachers and parents -- send us pics through a direct message to show us how you're adapting to distance learning.

#WEareSJSD #InThisTogether

post_text: The St. Joseph School District is canceling classes for Thursday, February 13, 2020 due to the extreme cold in the forecast and the potential for dangerous driving conditions. This includes Hillyard Technical Center, Webster’s Adult Education classes and preschool. All after school activities for Thursday, February 13 are also canceled. SJSD employees, please refer to Scenario A of the Inclement Weather Policy (see district email for details).

The Cotillion for Achievement recently held its annual ball honoring 16 outstanding Andrew and Buchanan county seniors. The Award of Distinction went to Ansh Gupta from Central High School. He also earned $1,800 in scholarship funds. Ansh tentatively plans to attend the University of Arizona to study astrophysics.

As finalists from the St. Joseph School District, Rylee Alden, Cruz Becerra, Carson Gaddie, Cameron Gilmore, Haleigh McCamy, Mason Murphy, LeeAnn Nordstrom, and Michael Tieman all received $900 scholarships. Congratulations to all of this year's honorees. #WEareSJSD
